page.title: 16BRIDGE SCHOOL-HAREWOOD
page.content: The school caters for boys with educational,home,social or police problems.Established in 1979 and financed by the Leeds Education Authority,it caters for 42 pupils,26 boys being weekly boarders.The ages range from 10 to 16 and all the boys are from the Leeds district.Staff include the headmaster,7 teachers,4 house-parents and a matron. The pupils study English and Maths. and do practical subjects such as wood and metal work.At the weekends they are involved in outdoor activities such as swimming,canoeing,walking, seaside visits and indoor activities such as snooker,table-tennis,chess and computer games. At 16 when the boys leave school, many cannot read, and none attempt public exams.Some follow training schemes:all find it hard to get jobs.
